business.headline: World braces for Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs: What's at stake?Uncertainty grows as the world braces for Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs. Global stock markets are volatile, major economies face tough choices, and fears of a trade war threaten to disrupt global commerce.

'Dirty 15' list: Which countries will suffer most from Trump's tariffs?The Trump administration has claimed that existing trade rules favour other countries at the expense of the US, and the new tariffs are seen as a response to these concerns.
Sensex gains 400 points, Nifty climbs as tariff impact fails to rattle D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 436.11 points to 76,460.62, while NSE Nifty50 added 106.30 points to 23,272.00 as of 9:34 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening today: What to expect from D-Street on Trump tariff day?Nifty and Sensex fell 1.5% and 1.8%, respectively, in the last session, marking their biggest single-day percentage fall in a month.

Stocks to watch on April 2: Shares in focus; Tata Motors, Swiggy, Coal IndiaShares of companies such as Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors, Tata Steel, Tata Consumer, Swiggy, Godavari Power, and Indian Bank will be in focus due to key developments.

New Income Tax rules: Know all rates, slabs, deductions and moreThe government has amended the income tax slabs under the new tax regime for FY 2025-26. According to the new structure, those earning up to Rs 4 lakh will pay no taxes.

Zomato lays off 600 customer support employees: ReportThe company hired nearly 1,500 customer support staff under Zomato's Zomato Associate Accelerator Program (ZAAP), with the goal of promoting them into various roles in sales, operations, supply chains and other departments, within a year.

1st trading day of FY26 ends in bloodbath: Top gainers, losers, key insightsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended nearly 1,400 points lower, while the NSE Nifty50 closed below 23,200. The uncertainty surrounding the Trump administration's expected reciprocal tariff imposition on imported goods triggered a significant sell-off, causing the domestic market to underperform other global indices.

Sensex falls nearly 1,400 points, Nifty tumbles 350 points; HCLTech tanks 4%The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 1,390.41 points to close at 76,024.51, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 353.65 points to end at 23,165.70.

Stock market crash: Why should investors watch out for rising volatility?The stock market fear index surged 10% on Tuesday as investors braced for the impact of US reciprocal tariffs, which are set to take effect from April 2.

Sensex down over 1,400 points: US tariff panic or other factors at play?Is the surrounding uncertainty reciprocal tariffs the only factor behind today's stock market bloodbath, or are other underlying issues driving the sharp correction? Read on to find out what's spooking Dalal Street investors.

Will EPFO raise claim withdrawal limit to Rs 5 lakh in April 2025? Check hereEPFO is planning to allow Provident Fund (PF) withdrawals via UPI and ATMs soon. This move will make it easier for members to withdraw their PF money without delays.

entertainment.headline: Singer Vishal Dadlani slams Studio Ghibli trendSinger-composer Vishal Dadalni recently criticised the Studio Ghibli trend on social media. He called it 'AI Plagiarisation.'

Empuraan box office Day 6: Mohanlal's film sees drop, eyes Rs 100 crore in IndiaMohanlal's L2: Empuraan, directed by Prithviraj Sukumaran, saw a slight drop in numbers on Tuesday. The film is marching towards Rs 100 crore nett at the domestic box office.

Salman Khan's Sikandar sees drop after decent start, earns Rs 19.5 crore on Day 3Salman Khan's Sikandar collected Rs 19.5 crore on Day 3, bringing its total to Rs 74.5 crore in India. The film faces competition from Mohanlal's L2: Empuraan.

Keanu Reeves to return as hitman in John Wick Chapter 5Actor Keanu Reeves and director Chad Stahelski are set to reunite for John Wick: Chapter 5. The upcoming installment was announced at CinemaCon in Las Vegas.

Apoorva Mukhija deletes all Instagram pics months after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija deleted her Instagram posts months after India's Got Latent controversy. Popularly known as The Rebel kid, she faced charges over her vulgar and offensive comments on the show.

Mohanlal-starrer Empuraan's re-edited version out in theatres after 24 cutsThe re-edited version of actor Mohanlal and director Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan was screened in theatres on Tuesday. The makers voluntarily went for re-censoring and the censor board suggested 24 cuts, including deletion of two minutes of footage.

Sydney Sweeney splits from fiancé Jonathan Davino: Here's whySydney Sweeney has ended her engagement to Jonathan Davino, prioritising her career over wedding plans. The Madame Webb star is focused on upcoming projects, including Euphoria and The Housemaid.

Docuseries on Justin Baldoni, Blake Lively's legal feud in worksA docuseries on the legal battle between actors Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni's will be available on Discovery, promising an intriguing look into the complexities of legal disputes.
Jennifer Lawrence welcomes second child with husband Cooke MaroneyActor Jennifer Lawrence welcomed her second child with her husband Cooke Maroney. The got married in October 2019.

Zoe Saldaña joins Kendrick Lamar and Gracie Abrams in Webby nominationsWith nearly 13,000 entries from over 70 countries, the competition includes viral music videos, top podcasts, and unexpected social media sensations. Voting for the Webby People's Voice Award is open until April 17, with winners announced on April 22.

Actor-comedian Kevin Hart to perform in India for the first timePopular actor-comedian Kevin Hart is set to make his first-ever performance in India as part of his global comedy tour. He is set to perform in the country on April 30.

Fawad Khan's comeback to Indian theatres already under scannerFawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor's upcoming film, Abir Gulaal, faces opposition from film associations in India, despite the Bombay High Court rejecting a 2023 petition to ban Pakistani artists. With producer groups and political parties firm in their stance, the film's future remains uncertain.

Jason Momoa confirms he is returning to the Dune universeHollywood star Jason Momoa will be returning to the science-fiction world of Dune, the actor confirmed in a recent interview. He played Duncan Idaho in the first part.

Barkha Bisht recalls relationship with Karan Singh GroverIn a candid interview, Barkha Bisht discussed her past relationships, revealing the reasons behind her breakup with Karan Singh Grover. She shared that she was attracted to his kindness, and grew apart.

Karthi on Sardar 2: The sequel will feature a much bigger warThe teaser for the highly anticipated sequel, Sardar 2, showcases Karthi reprising his dual roles as Indian spy Sardar and his son Vijay, gearing up for a much larger war.

Gulshan Devaiah on working with Anurag Kashyap: He's so full of himself but...Gulshan Devaiah recently revealed his thoughts on working with Anurag Kashyap, calling him confident yet collaborative. The actor shared his experience during a Reddit AMA session.

Asit Modi reacts to Disha Vakani's return to Taarak Mehta: We can only prayProducer Asit Kumar Modi broke his silence on the ongoing rumours about the possibility of the return of the character Dayaben in Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah. He also revealed whether there's a possibility of actor Disha Vakani's return.

5 South Indian sequels beyond Baahubali, KGF, Pushpa, that clicked with fansLast weekend witnessed a slew of film releases, including sequels like Mohanlal's L2: Empuraan and Mad Square, as well as prequels such as Veera Dheera Sooran Part 2 and Robinhood. Here are five recent South Indian sequels that struck a chord with audiences.

Esha Deol wants Dhoom to re-release: Kids still remember me for the filmActor Esha Deol recently said she wants Dhoom to be released again in cinemas. Apart from Deol, the film starred Abhishek Bachchan, Uday Chopra and John Abraham in the lead.

general news.headline: Waqf bill to be tabled in Lok Sabha today amid NDA-INDIA bloc showdown Live UpdatesThe Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, is set to be introduced in the Lok Sabha today. The Bill seeks to amend the 1995 Waqf Act to address issues in managing Waqf properties, but the opposition plans to vote against it after a full discussion.

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says Studio Ghibli frenzy will cause stuff to breakThe Studio Ghibli frenzy continues, and OpenAI's team is still struggling to manage the surge a week after launching the image generation tool. CEO Sam Altman warns that due to the overload, users should expect system breakages and delays in product releases.

What makes Blanco the 'green flag' Selena Gomez (and every girl) truly deservesBenny Blanco isn't just another celebrity boyfriend - he stands out in a world where emotional availability in men often feels like a rare commodity.

In longest ever Senate speech, Booker raves against Trump for 24 hours non-stopSen. Cory Booker set a 25-hour Senate speech record, protesting Trump's tariff plans and policies. Meanwhile, Trump announced new tariffs and layoffs affecting thousands.

Watched 'Money Heist', learnt tricks from YouTube: How gang looted Karnataka SBIKarnataka police cracked the Nyamati SBI bank heist in Davangere, arresting six culprits and recovering almost all stolen gold. The mastermind, inspired by Money Heist, executed the robbery using advanced tools.

Watch: Sunita Williams's heartwarming reunion with her dogs after returning homeNearly two weeks after her return to Earth, Sunita Williams has now shared a heartwarming video of her long-awaited reunion with her dogs. In the video, she is seen stepping out of her house, only to be greeted excitedly by her two Labrador retrievers -- Gunner and Gorby.

University of Bath School of Management: A Pathway to Global Career SuccessBath's School of Management blends top academics, hands-on learning, and career support to help students secure jobs at leading global companies.

Commuters to pay more to go to Bengaluru airport as toll hike comes into effectThe Union Government approved a toll hike on the Bengaluru airport road, raising charges at the Sadahalli toll plaza. Commuters and transport operators express concerns over increased travel costs.

Ahead of Waqf war in Parliament, your guide to the new bill and row over itA big showdown is expected in Parliament today as the Waqf (Amendment) Bill will be taken up for discussion and passage. While the BJP and many of its allies have rallied behind the bill, the Opposition has vowed to stand against it.
Why a usual US bombing campaign will not bring Iran to heelFor Trump, any amplified war with Iran will stand against his promises of not dragging the US into wars in faraway lands.

Over 1 lakh Awami League members fled to India, claims Bangladesh advisorA Bangladesh government advisor claims over 1 lakh Awami League members fled to India. He accuses Sheikh Hasina of conspiring from abroad and criticises her tenure.

US will boom: Trump rejects stagflation fears as experts warn of economic crisisDonald Trump dismissed concerns about stagflation, insisting the US economy is poised for a boom even as experts warn his policies, including tariffs and layoffs, could trigger an economic slowdown and inflation.

Security guard thrashed by Raj Thackeray's party workers for not knowing MarathiMNS workers were caught on camera confronting and thrashing a security guard for not being able to converse in Marathi. In the video, the security guard was seen with folded hands as the MNS workers rebuked him.

Pics: Kareena, Janhvi, Aditya and others bring glam to Vivienne Westwood's showFashion brand Vivienne Westwood hosted their first ever show in Mumbai on April 1. The star-studded affair saw several celebrities, including Kareena Kapoor, Janhvi Kapoor, Aditya Roy Kapur, Mira Rajput and Vaani Kapoor, among others, in attendance.

BJP likely to get new national president by third week of April: SourcesThe BJP's search for a new party president to succeed Jagat Prakash Nadda is likely to pick speed once the Parliament session is over, sources said.

Chinnaswamy Stadium will create an intimidating atmosphere for the opposition ahead of their first home game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Gujarat Titans (GT).

With a revamped bowling attack and momentum on their side, they aim to overcome past woes at home.

Rs 27 crore for what? Rishabh Pant slammed after hat-trick of failures for LSGRishabh Pant's dismal start to IPL 2025 continues as fans criticise the Lucknow Super Giants skipper for failing to justify his Rs 27 crore price tag. With just 17 runs in three matches, Pant's performance has left supporters frustrated and questioning his value.

Rob Walter steps down as South Africa men's head coachAfter signing a four-year deal with the Proteas, Rob Walter has put down his papers as the head coach of the South Africa men's white-ball teams.

MI coach replaces Jon Lewis as England Women's head coachEngland Women have named Charlotte Edwards as their new head coach, replacing Jon Lewis, who resigned from his position after the Ashes in Australia where they lost 0-16.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
